description: Dataset containing the number of healthcare services locations per 1000 inhabitants by census tract.

variables.name: den_allphysicians
variables.description: All offices or clinics of physicians per 1000 people
variables.source_notes: Physicians (except mental health and osteopathy), including family medicine and oncologists, pediatricians, obstetrician/gynecologists, ophthalmologists, and general/internal medicine practitioners as well as specialists such as cardiologists, dermatologists.

variables.name: den_mentalhealthphys
variables.description: Offices or clinics of mental health physicians per 1000 people
variables.source_notes: Mental health physicians, such as psychiatrists and psychotherapists with medical degrees (but excluding those without a medical degree such as psychologists and counselors).

variables.name: den_outpatientclinics
variables.description: All outpatient medical clinics including Urgent Care centers and HMO per 1000 people
variables.source_notes: Includes ambulatory surgical centers, freestanding emergency medical centers, HMOs, and other outpatient medical centers; also includes kidney dialysis centers and other outpatient specialty clinics, such as physical therapy clinics, mental health clinics, respiratory therapy clinics, and weight loss clinics.

variables.name: den_pharmacies
variables.description: Retail pharmacies and drug stores per 1000 people
variables.source_notes: Establishments engaged in the retail sale of prescription drugs, proprietary drugs, and non-prescription medicines, and which may also carry a number of related lines, such as cosmetics and toiletries.

notes: Census tract based on 2020 Census Tract designations
